CIRCULAR No. AS-_23_/2006

Subject: Courtesy and protocol to be extended to the Hon'ble
MPs at airports by the CISF personnel,

BCAS circular No. 2/2004 specifically provides that due courtesy is

extended fo the Hon’ble Member of Parliament during their visit to
airports. Their PICs entitled them to go upto the certain area in the
airport without any entry pass.

According to the reports available, at times, Hon'ble MPs have

faced. inconvenience at. airports. ASGs are directed to take following
action in such cases;

(i) Sometimes, the hon'ble MPs have open tickets and CiSF
personnel have requested them to get the same confirmed from the
airline counter outside the airport. As the Hon'ble MP can go upto
the check-in area on the basis of their PICs, they should be allowed
to go to the airline counter in the check-in area for getting
confirmation of the ticket.

(ii) At the time of VVIP/VIP visits at various airports, MPs and
MLs and other senior political functionaries , sometimes, want to
receive the VVIP/VIP at the ladder point. According to the para
4.15 of the SOPs, “CASO will maintain liaison with the state
govt/local police authorities for making arrangement during the visit
of the VVIP along with the Airport Director. A list of the authorized
persons to visit the airport. ”, Therefore, the CASOs should take
initiative and get passes issued from the Airport Director for
MPs/MLAs and other party functionaries as decided by the local
authorities so that no last minute confusion occurs on this account.
If the CASOs do their hame work properly in this regard, it is felt that
there will no occasion for a communication gap occurring between
the senior public figures and the CISF.

(iii) During high alerts and under special circumstances, extra
security checks are carried out on a person. ‘If, however, the
identity of the passenger as a MP is revealed before extra checks
are carried out, then the CISF personnel on duty should avoid going
ahead with the same on account of the position of high responsibility
being enjoyed by the Members of the Parliament. Routine security
checks should, however, continue to be carried out as per BCAS
instructions.

(iv) During security checks, sometimes, queries may be made by
the Hon'ble Members of the Parliament from CISF personnel
regarding the necessity of various procedures adopted during
security checks. The CISF personnel should be sensitized to
answer all such queries with patience, courtesy and good manners.

CASOs are requested to sensitize every CISF personnel of the unit

about the requirements mentioned above.
